title: The Job
description: Michael appoints Dwight as regional manager, anticipating that he will receive the job at corporate. Jim and Karen also interview for the same position. And Michael gets back together with Jan after she gets a boob job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [at Dunder-Mifflin Corporate in NY] David!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [confused] Oh, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are we all set?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Isn't our interview tomorrow?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. I just happened to be in the neighborhood, thought I'd drop in and say hello.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: You happened to be in mid-town Mahattan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thought I'd catch a show.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: In the middle of a work day?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Naaah. You know what? Since I'm here, let me ask you a few questions about the job.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, how many people are you interviewing?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: We're only interviewing the branch managers and some other upper level company people.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, well, good. Out of curiosity are you interviewing anyone who has been here longer than I have, or manages more people?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Great. One more... question. When you merged those branches who did you put in charge?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I believe we put you in charge.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, great. No further questions.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I'm really looking forward to our interview.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I'm really looking forward to working with you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I got it made in the shade. I know this company. The other branch managers are total morons. [on cell phone] Hey, Pam yeah, I forgot what day the interview was and I drove to New York accidentially. I'll be like three hours late.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Jim walk through the door sporting an obvious new haircut] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Kev.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What's different about you? You look worse.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You got a haircut. It's sexy, hot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ohhh...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Turn around.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No way.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Do it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Blup-dup-do. What's up, Big Haircut? You are no longer Big Tuna. From henceforth, you shall be known as Big Haircut.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [exhales loudly] Andy...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What is it, Big Haircut?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sorry, I can't hear you Big Haircut.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Karen suggested that I get a haircut for the interview tomorrow so that I could look presentable and not, as she so lovingly puts it, homeless.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey. I think it looks great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: After I had my little outburst at the beach, Jim was really nice about it. He just basically said that he missed my friendship too and I would always mean a lot to him and I understand where he's coming from.  For the record, I am not embarassed at all. It needed to be said, and I said it, and it only took me three years to summons the courage, so [quietly, and mock bowing] thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [knock on door] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You wanted to see me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, the time has come to name my own replacement. So please hand this letter of congratulations to Dwight K. Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But that's my name. [opens letter and reads] Dwight, congratuations a-wipe.  Don't screw the pooch. [begins to cry]  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Uh...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [cries harder] Thank you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sobbing, holding letter to chest] Thank you so much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop crying.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sobbing] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohhhhh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, about the beach...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: It's okay, we all say things without thinking.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no it's not that, I've actually been thinking that for a long time, and I'm glad I said it. I just... I'm sorry if it made you feel weird.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [confused] Oh. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Pam is... kind of a bitch.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey, what if we leave tonight? Grab a bite, get a hotel room, enjoy the city a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ahhh... just have so much paperwork to do. [exhales] Wow. Done. Okay, let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So I was wondering if Karen and I could get off a few hours early 'cause we want to spend the night in the city.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why so you can do it?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [looks annoyed]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoops.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, um, well I was thinking that uh, actually we could all leave tomorrow and do a convoy you know?  Convoys are really fun.  Pull up next to each other, give each other the finger...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmmm.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Heh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Moon each other.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, we're gonna go tonight, but we're gonna see you there tomorrow morning, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your loss.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Wait, how would you moon us if you were driving?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cruise control.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So Jim, who do you think is hotter? Pam or Karen?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm not going to talk about this now.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Pam is taller.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You sure?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes. She has bigger breasts, too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think Karen has a prettier face.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, hmm. [thinking] Uh, hmm. What else?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well I mean Pam's face is really pretty too. It's a very tough call.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hm. Really tough call.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? Why don't you take the rest of the day, figure it out and then come back and tell me what you got.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Will do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right. [smiles]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, Pam I've been meaning to say something to you.  I really miss our friendship. [group laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow, very funny.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I've never heard you talk that much. I thought it was Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Are you kidding? I would have never done that. It was pathetic-ville. No offense, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [smiles]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You know what? Don't even worry about it. Everyone was so drunk, I bet no one even remembers what you said.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I remember. I blogged the whole thing.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: www.creedthoughts.gov.www/creedthoughts. Check it out.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Last year Creed asked me how to set up a blog. Wanting to protect the world from being exposed to Creed's brain I opened up a Word document on his computer and put an address at the top. I've read some of it. Even for the intranet it's... pretty shocking.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There they are, the Accounting Department. I shall miss your humility and your promptly printed checks.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Do you think it's gonna to be weird working with Jan in New York?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Not at all. I haven't talked to Jan since we broke up, and I think if she had something to say she would have called me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Maybe you should talk to her? Before...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. You know what? It's a done deal. I basically have the job already. There's nothing she can do to stop it now. I already sold my condo.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm sorry, that just doesn't make sense.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Wha? Who gave you that advice?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, Michael you should never sell your condo...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have to buy another place.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: But you said you were in debt. [crosstalk]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You're not sure that you have the job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I sold it on eBay. The buyer was very motivated, as was I. It went for eighty percent of what I paid.  Sold in record time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How would you like to spend the night with the Regional Manager of Dunder-Mifflin, Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No Dwight, I don't care if that is how they consolidated power in ancient Rome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, not Michael. [whispers] Me. I'm taking his job.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [smiles] Not now. [Dwight leaves] Goodbye, Kelly Kapoor.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [squeezing hand grips] Jim, Jim, Jim.  Jim, Jim, Jim, Jim, Jim, Jim, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh hey, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am gonna be your new boss. [laughs] It's my greatest dream come true.  Welcome to the Hotel Hell.  Check in time is now.  Check out time is never.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Does my room have cable?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. And the sheets are made of fire.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I change rooms?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sorry, we're all booked up. Hell convention in town.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I have a late checkout?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll have to talk to the manager.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're not the manager even in your own fantasy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm the owner.  The co-owner. With Satan!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, just so I understand it, in your wildest fantasy you are in Hell and you are co-running a bed and breakfast with the devil?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, but I haven't told you my salary yet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eighty thousand dollars a year.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Once I'm officially Regional Manager my first order of business will be to demote Jim Halpert. So I will need a new number two.  My ideal choice? Jack Bauer. But he is unavailable. Fictional. And overqualified.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [signing interview sheet] I will see you at the inter-view.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes you will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who is D. Abramson?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He's from that company in Pitts...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [walks through front door] Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why... are you here?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm good. How are you, Janet? It's good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I'm great. Uh, can we, can we talk... privately... for a minute?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why privately?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I just, [quietly] I uh... I don't uh... I, I don't, I don't like the way that we left things.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, sure, fine. Um, why don't you wait in my office. I have some important business matters to take care of.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, Defcon ten. Houston, we have a problem.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do you want me to do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, I may need some immediate assistance. If you would slowly and quietly gather the ladies in the conference room. Phyllis, Angela, Karen.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What about Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. She's an alternate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, how you been?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Been good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Sorry to drop by unexpectedly. I uh, I tried calling, but I kept getting voice mail.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Weird. Yeah, I didn't get both of your messages.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, um, Michael needs us in the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: 'Cause of Jan again?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey, uh, before I leave tonight, would you mind making a half a dozen copies of Jim's and my sales reports for our interviews tomorrow?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, sure.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I really hope you get the job.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Thanks. [looks suspicious]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: After you ended... everything with us, I went on a vacation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: To kinda clear my mind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sound good. Sounds fun.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It was.  Yeah, it was good. [laughs] I think I'll just get right to the point, you know?  Um, I, I feel good about myself for the first time in a really long time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm..

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I've made some big changes in my life and... I miss you. I want us to get back together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would you excuse me for a second?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ohh... [Michael leaves and walks into conference room]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Defcon twenty.  She wants to get back together.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What are you gonna do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know, that's why you're here, help me. Please...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Do you want to get back together with her?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. What do I do?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just don't get back together with her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What if she makes me?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: How can she make you get back together with her?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She made me do a lot of things I didn't wanna do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This was a terrible relationship. You were not happy when you were with her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I wasn't.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're so much happier now. Just go in there and be strong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're right. You're absolutely right. I'm gonna go in there and tell her that we can't be together.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm in a very good place right now. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walks back into office with Jan] Okay. [clears throat] Jan, we need to talk. [Jan turns revealing that she has had her breasts enlarged]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan is in a different place right now, and it is a sign of maturity to give people second chances. So I am going to hear her out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God. [mouths to Jim] Huge!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, bigger actually.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispers] That's crazy!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm-hm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [mouths] Wow!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [moves to block Jim from Pam's eyeline] Oh my God.  Can you believe that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Unbelievable.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She could put the cup right there.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I know!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, it's fine.  I'm sure it must have been weird for Jim when Roy and I were joking around... that one time.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I would never do that.  Waste of money.  In my experience, guys are way more attracted to the back of you than the front.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I love fake boobs.  Often times, you find them on strippers.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I find it offensive.  Au natural, baby.  That's how I like 'em.  Swing low, sweet chariots.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So... [exhales] there are a lot of things that I would like to do differently.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I feel like, when we first got together, that I had a problem with my priorities.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: First got priorities.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And if we could talk about a way to approach a possible reconciliation...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's get back together. [Jan smiles and laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.  No, no, no, no.  I'll tell you this, it is not because of the boob job.  Excuse me, boob enhancement.  That would be shallow.  And this is the opposite of shallow.  This is... emotionally magnificent.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, everyone, listen up! [claps]  Time to begin the interview process! [looks at sign-up sheet, only contains Andy's name]  Andrew Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Saving the best for first!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: All right, you guys.  See you later, wish us luck!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No! Hey, hey, hey, hey!  Do not wish them luck.  Do not wish them luck.  All luck must be wished unto Michael.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Good luck, you guys! [everyone wishes them luck]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What did I say!?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Jim] Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm happy for him.  I hope he gets the job.  I really just want him to be happy.  And I know that sounds cliche.  And I know saying it sounds cliche, sounds cliche...  Maybe I'm being cliche.  I don't care.  Cause I am what I am. [thinks] That's Popeye.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am going to begin this process with a simple test of intelligence and mental dexterity.  What is the best color?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: White, because it contains all other colors.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wrong.  Black.  It is the most dominant.  How do you make a table?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You make a chair, but you don't sit on it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is the capital of Maine?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The capital of Maine is Montpelier, Vermont, which is near Ithaca, New York, where I went to Cornell.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, also, moratorium on Cornell talk.  Don't wanna hear about it.  Forget your personal history, and learn the history of this company.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Should not be a problem. I minored in history in the Ivy League school which I attended.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're not off to a very good start, Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I agree. But in another way, I am off to a very good start, wouldn't you say?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am a great interviewee. Why? Because I have something no one else has: my brain. Which I use to my advantage, when advantageous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Andy and Dwight arm-wrestle, Andy is about to win] Time! No, you failed.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Damn it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This interview is over. I'll let you know.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [Driving to New York] Hey, thank you so much for driving me down for my interview.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Totally, no problem.  What are you interviewing for, by the way, my assistant? Or...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh, you know I'm gonna have a congratulations Karen party um, tomorrow night at my friend's house.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh wow, that sounds like fun. Is your friend named Karen too?  What did she accomplish?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: No, I'm sorry I should have been clearer. It's for me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: 'Cause I'm going to get the job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holding Jan's breasts] Remarkable.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait, wait. Check one more time.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very good [Jan nods]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, I um, I have to get back, but I will see you in New York tomorrow, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, indeed.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Good luck with your interview. [whispers] Bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, I guess we're getting back together.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What happened?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your advice was good, but Jan's was bigger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here's the sitch. Two weeks ago, I was in the worst relationship of my life.  She treated me poorly.  We didn't connect, I was miserable. Now, I'm in the best relationship of my life with the same woman.  Love is a mystery.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: So we have all night.  Where do you want to go first?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I dunno, how about the U.N.?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: How often do you come here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, everytime my sixth grade class has a field trip.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I think you'll really enjoy this, adult Jim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, everybody.  The next time you see me, I'll be working for corporate. Starting tomorrow, Dwight Schrute will be running the branch. So without further ado,  [clicks on small tape player] I would like to start saying my goodbyes [Song: Thank You, by Natalie Merchant plays in background] Okay. Goodnight, and good luck.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Dwight clicks off tape player] Who's ready to work?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Karen punches buttons on an ATM] Yeah, we went to the Spotted Pig for dinner. It's in the Village. Uh, Karen knew it. And then we second acted Spamalot. That's when you sneak in at intermission with all the smokers. And then we went to a bar that used to be a church. Oh and at this one bar, I swear I saw Lorne Michaels.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: That wasn't him. [Jim nods, mouths, yes, it was]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: So what's going to happen to us when I get this job?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh do you mean when I get the job?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Well, if you get the job then I'd move here with you. Would you move with me?  I'm not stupid. I was at the beach.  We won't have a future in Scranton. There's one too many people there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You mean Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Exactly.  But you get it, right? Can't stay there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I do. C'mon. [they hold hands and cross street]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [exhales] How are you guys doing?  Need anything?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Uh, no, we're good.  Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have been here a bunch of times, so I know where everything is, know everybody's names.  If you need to know somebody's name, just ask me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [points at bearded man] Who's that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is Beardy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Beardy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm gonna introduce myself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, just... that's not his real name.  That's just what I call him, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am by far the most qualified person they're interviewing.  Jim and Karen are here, which is cute.  They're like, kid actors tagging along with daddy, on the big audition, hoping to be discovered.  Except daddy... is the best actor around.  Daddy is Meryl Streep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael is gone.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hail to the chief!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My first order of business: make Andrew Bernard my number two.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My first order of business: accept.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: As if you had a choice. [scoffs] Duh. [scoffs] Opportunity of a lifetime. [spits chew into Michael's World's Best Boss mug]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Three months ago, I was nowhere.  I was just a Cornell grad, in anger management.  Look where I am now.  Not bad. [washing out Michael's mug]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey!  Hunter!  Wha's up my brutha?  This is Hunter, secretary extraordinaire.

quotes.speaker: Hunter
quotes.text: Uh, administrative assistant.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan in yet?

quotes.speaker: Hunter
quotes.text: I think she's comin' in... later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Could you give her a message for me, when she gets in?

quotes.speaker: Hunter
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just say, "I want to squeeze them."  It's code.  She'll know what it means.

quotes.speaker: Hunter
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, and Hunter?  Could you tell her, [Michael shakes his head and makes the "motorboat" noise] "Brbrbrbrbr!" also?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You showed great leadership potential at the coal walk.  Even if you did follow it with that embarrassing personal confession.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I had to make Andy my number two.  It's political, complicated, you wouldn't understand.  I want you... to be Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, in a sense.  Although, publicly I am going to retain the Assistant Regional Manager position.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You will be your own assistant.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Correct, I need someone I can trust.  But I would also like the title... to be secretly applied to you.  Just stripped of its pomp and frills.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.  So... you would be the Regional Manager, and the Assistant Regional Manager.  Andy is your number two.  I would be the Secret Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mmmmmm, let's call it Secret Assistant to the Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you accept?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Absolutely, I do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I learned from Jim, if Dwight ever asks you to accept something secret... you reply, "Absolutely, I do."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [knocks on door] Hello, hello!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael, good to see you!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good to see you.  Here are the post-merger performance stats that you asked for.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Oh, great.  I've been meaning to thank you by the way.  You didn't lose a single customer during the merger, and you still managed to trim the budget?  That is nice work. [Michael smiles] So, let me ask you a question right off the bat.  What do you think are your greatest strengths as a manager?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don't I tell you what my greatest weaknesses are?  I work too hard.  I care too much.  And sometimes I can be too invested in my job.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay.  And your strengths?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, my weaknesses are actually... strengths.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Oh.  Yes.  Very good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Very good.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Dwight is our new boss.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh, Michael's not going anywhere.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Then who do you think will get the job?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Karen.  She looks corporate.  Those little pants suits.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I think it's gonna be Michael.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Do you really think he's qualified for that job?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No, but he wasn't qualified for the job he has now, and he got that one.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [laughs] Mm.  Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen up!  Come to the center of the room, please.  This... [holds up paper that resemles a sheet sized dollar bill with Dwight's face in the middle] is a Schrute Buck.  When you have done something good, you will receive one Schrute Buck.  One thousand Schrute Bucks... equals an extra five minutes for lunch.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [raises hand] What is the cash value of a Schrute Buck?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excellent question, Pam.  1/100th of a cent.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: So ten thousand of your dollars is worth one real dollar?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just... zip your lid!  Another announcement.  Michael wasted an enormous amount of the group's time and patience with non-work related ethnic celebrations and parades of soft-minded dogoodedness.  No longer.  No more meetings!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Amen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Instead, today I will begin my first lecture in a long series of lectures designed to increase your knowledge on the world of paper.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [raises hand] Do we have to?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!  Michael is gone.  There's a new sheriff here in these offices, and his name is "me."  Conference room!  Ten seconds!  All of you!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I literally cannot wait to see what Dwight has planned.  And I wish Jim were here.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: What do you think we could be doing better?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I've never been a big fan of the name Dunder Mifflin.  I was thinking we could name the company something like, "Paper Great.  Where great paper is our passion.  We're GRRRRRRRRRREAT!"  I don't know, could be good.  Or, uh, "Super Duper Paper.  It's super duper."  I don't know, something like that.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Thanks for comin' in, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: It is always a treat when our paths cross.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is always a treat when our paths cross.  So, oh!  Before I forget, I wanted to let you know, if you hadn't already heard, uh, Jan and I are back together.  So... I may need to fill out one of those love documents again.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: You're back together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.  And I am very excited about the prospect of working under her... or on top of her. [laughs] Mm, that's not sexual, just... we're all professionals.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay, uh.  Well, I thought it was clear in the description, the position... the job you're applying for... is Jan's job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't understand. So, we're gonna tag team it?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No, we're letting Jan go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen up.  Let's start... from the ground up.  Where does paper come from?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [at the same time as Dwight] Trees.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Trees!  And where do trees grow?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [at the same time as Dwight] Forest.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Soil. Right.  We have, in front of you here, seven different types of Pennsylvania top soil.  Now, what would you say... is the most important element in the production of above ground leafy growth?  Probably phosphorus, right? [Angela smiles, shakes her head "no"]  Wrong!  It's nitrogen!  Absorb this information.  Good!  Now, let us discuss precipitation.  Stanley!  When rainfall occurs, does it usually fall in a liquid, solid, or gaseous... state?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Liquid.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very good!  You have earned one Schrute Buck.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don't want it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Then you have been deducted 50 Schrute Bucks!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Make it 100.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We-- Don't you wanna earn Schrute Bucks?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No.  In fact, I'll give you a billion Stanley Nickels if you never talk to me again.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's the ratio of Stanley Nickels to Schrute Bucks?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: The same as the ratio of unicorns to leprechauns.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Class is canceled, everybody out!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No wait, what are you doing?!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm punishing them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no, wait!  Class is not canceled.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: [grumbling, getting loud]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: HEY!  COME ON!  Let's listen to Dwight's presentation! [Dwight winks at Pam]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What-- What are you winking for?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Zip your lid!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: So, that's... my basic 5 year plan.  And after that, who knows?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay.  Uh, now, this may seem like an odd question, but...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: ...what do you think about Michael Scott?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: He's a very nice man.  And he's very well suited for the job he has now.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: This is off the record.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: He would be disaster.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hey you!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: How was your interview?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Could have gone better I guess.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh. [they kiss] I'll put in a good word for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool.  Maybe you should do it sooner rather than later.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Daaah, let's just run away together.  Let's just run away to Jamaica and live in a bungalow.  You have some savings right?  You could pay off my debts.  It would... be fine.  We'd have fun.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What's... what's the matter?  What... what happened in there?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't tell you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Tell me what?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You son of a bitch!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Jan, this isn't the time, we're in an interview--

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You're firing me?  Where the hell do you get off?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Frankly, it's overdue.  Your behavior in the last two years has been completely erratic.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Erratic?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Recently, you don't even show an interest in your work!  You smoke constantly in your office.  You spend most of the day online shopping.  You disappear for hours at a time, sometimes days.  Always saying you're visiting your sister in Scottsdale.  You go to Scranton far more often than you used to--

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [opens up her overcoat] Is it because of these?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wuuuoooh, hey, whoa, Jan--

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, I wanna know.  I wanna know!  Because if it is, then, then, then I will see you in court!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: It's not.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: It's not.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: 'Cause he likes them. [points to Michael] Okay? He likes them. And, and that is, that is all I care about.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: The time has come for you to end your professional relationship with this company.  You are clearly unstable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey!  You're  unstable!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No-- We're all unstable.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, you know what?  I'm just not leaving.  I'm not leaving.  Not leaving.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: David, I did not tell her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's like staring into my soul, when I look at this wall.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's like outerspace without the stars, it's so black. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is gonna look so awesome!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's so intimidating!  Anyone who comes in here... is gonna have to take me seriously.  Abandon all hope, ye who enter here!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [laughs] Totally!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [giving a hug] Bye Hunter.

quotes.speaker: Hunter
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Good luck with your band.

quotes.speaker: Hunter
quotes.text: Oh, thank--

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Don't let them change you, okay? [Jan drops several items, Michael and Hunter help pick them up, she starts to walk out the door] So long, [censored].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, I am gonna... give her a ride home.  Let me know about the job.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Actually, Michael, I think we're gonna take it in another direction.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, I'm glad we're on the same page.  I have a lot of ideas for new directions.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No, we're not giving you the job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what?  That... is actually good... because, um, I don't think I could take... my girlfriend's job.  That's not being a good boyfriend.  So, I respectfully withdraw my name from consideration.  Do you accept my withdrawal?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.  Very good.  I'm glad we are finally on the same page.  Still have my job in Scranton, though.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.  That's all I ever wanted.  These two. [points at Jim and Karen] Either one of them... excellent candidates.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Wow.  That was some serious... hardcore... self destruction.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.  Kinda feel bad for her though.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Don't!  She's nuts! [they laugh]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, man.  You know what?  This might take a while.  You really don't have to stay, if you don't want.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Okay, good!  Because, um, a bunch of my friends are meeting downtown for lunch.  And, I was gonna meet them, so...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Just call me when you're done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Good luck, Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.text: [phone rings, picks up] Dunder Mifflin, this is Grace.  Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, God!  I mean, I just don't understand!  It's just so rude, you know?  I mean, the absolute nerve of that guy!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.  I know, I'm sorry about that.  That was terrible.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, just... No, actually I think it's good, you know?  It's fine, actually, I do.  I really think it's great that it happened.  Because, you know, my work has always been the thing that has gotten in the way of my happiness, so... [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it's... [Jan starts crying, high pitched whining] No, don't cry, it's gonna be OK.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [sobbing] Oh, I know, I know.  It's just... I'm sorry.  It's just these painkillers that I started taking since the surgery.  Ohhh!  They make my moods totally unpredictable!  Wow!  What am I gonna do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [whispers] I don't know.  [normal volume] Well I guess... you could come and stay at my condo.  I think I could back out of the sale. [Jan exhales] Probably get some negative feedback on my eBay profile.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Live together.  Actually, wait a minute!  This could be great!  This could be perfect!  You know, my full-time job could be our relationship.  I could wear stretch pants and wait for you to come home at 5:15. [laughs] It could work.  This could work, really!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in the office, imitating the terminator] I'll be baaaaack!  And I am baaaack!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How'd it go?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.  No, Pam.  I'm baaaaaack!  For gooood!  Kevin Nealon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everybody, may I have your attention please?  It is with great honor and privilege that I announce to you that I have officially withdrawn my name for consideration from the corporate job.  I know, I know, I know.  "Michael, what are you thinking?  You were a shoe in."  Well, got down there.  I nailed the interview.  And the strangest thing happened.  Why is my office black?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: To intimidate my subordinates.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's stupid.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It was Andy's idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You shouldn't have taken it.  Bad management!  Good thing I'm baaaaaack.  [laughs] Ryan, coffee.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't do that stuff anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it's for me, bimbo.  Kids.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I'm back.  And I am never, ever going to leave.  I am going nowhere.  This place... is like... the hospital where I was born, my house, my old age home, and my... graveyard... for my bones.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did... Karen get the job?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to everyone] Back to work. [to Ryan] Still waitin' on that coffee.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam, hello.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, hello.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I wanted to thank you... for helping me, when you held the title, Secret Assistant to the Regional Manager.  You served the office with great dignity. [Pam salutes Dwight, Dwight returns the salute]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I don't know what the future holds, but... I'm optimistic.  And, uh, I had fun goofing around with Dwight today.  Jim and I... are just... too similar.  Maybe one day I'll find my own Karen. But-- you-- that is, a, um, you know, not-- A man.  A man version.  But, uh, until then... I can hold my head up. ... I'm not gay.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I don't know how I feel about hiring a Sixers fan.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I should leave. [pretends to get up] [they laugh]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Uh, let me ask you a question, Jim.  You're clearly a very bright guy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Always hit your numbers, personable, you make a great impression on everyone you meet--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sorry, wait, so is the question "How'd I get to be so awesome?" [laughs] Because, I don't have an answer for you. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Uh, oh, hey, do you have your quarterly numbers?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, absolutely.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: And that, uh, questionnaire.  Sorry to make you fill that thing out...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, no, absolutely.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: ...that's a HR formality.  We have this very irritating HR guy here, he's probably the only person you're not gonna like.  [Jim notices a small note inside his papers, it reads "Jim, Don't forget us when you're famous!  Pam"  It has a gold medal yogurt lid attached.] Kendall.  Ugh.  So, first up...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [hands David his papers] There you go.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: How do you think you function here in New York?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [not thinking clearly because of Pam's note] What's that? Oh, uh, great.  You know?  I just um, I really appreciate the buildings, and uh, the people, and um, there's just a [sic] energy... New York has, uh...  Not to mention, they have places that are open past eight.  [David laughs] So that's a... bonus.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: You've been in the Scranton branch a long time. [Jim stares at Pam's note] What have you liked most about that place?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [thinks] The friendships.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay.  Well, we want the person who takes this position to be here for the long haul.  So... long haul.  Where do you see yourself in ten years?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [flashback to Beach Games] How are your feet?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Medium rare.  Thanks. [they laugh]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The real reason that I went to Stamford... was because... I wanted to be... not here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And even though... I came back, I just, I feel like I've never really... come back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I wish you would.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [phone rings, Pam answers] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.  Just one moment, I'll transfer you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I haven't heard anything, but I bet Jim got the job.  I mean, why wouldn't he?  He's totally qualified, and smart, everyone loves him... and, if he never comes back again... that's OK.  We're friends.  And I'm sure we'll stay friends.  We just, we never got the timing right.  You know?  I shot him down, and then he did the same to me, and...  But you know what?  It's OK.  I'm totally fine.  Everything is gonna be totally-- [Jim walks in]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam.  [to camera] Sorry. [to Pam] Um, are you free for dinner tonight?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.  Then... it's a date.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to camera, tearing up, smiling] I'm sorry, what was the question?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [on phone] So, I know we left the other day on a note of uncertainty.  But, after some more thought, I'm very pleased to be able to offer you this job.  [laughs] Great!  I'm so glad.  We're all very excited you're going to be joining us.  It'll be nice to have another MBA around here.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [on phone, smiling] I'm excited too.  Okay.  Bye.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Who was that?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [still smiling] Nobody.  You and I are done.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What?! [Ryan smiles and glances at the camera]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Where do you see yourself in ten years?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, [clears throat] I've actually done a lot of thinking about that.  And in ten years, I am living in a big house, with my kids.  And in this house we have screens on the walls that have famous art on them and I have a remote that works everything, that has like a belt-loop attachment, or in my ear, like a gluetooth.  And, because it's the future, I can take just a little tiny pill and get all my vitamins for the whole day.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: A... multivitamin?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I don't know what it's gonna be called, but... my point is, the future of this company is now.  And the future... is me.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, what happened?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan got fired.  And I realized that I could not work for a company that would fire my girlfriend.   But more than that, I realized that... I couldn't take a job that would take me away from this place.  This is where I belong.  This is... my home.  And home is where the hardest.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Home is where the heart is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Heart is.  That makes a lot more sense.  You think they'd help each other out like that at corporate? [Oscar shrugs] I think not!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, if Michael gets the job, I will be so upset, because Dwight used to have a crush on me, so if he's boss, it'll be really awkward.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm. [nods]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: But if Jim gets it, you should be happy, because you have a crush on him, and he totally doesn't feel the same way, and then he'll be gone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, well, you know, whatever happens. [Kelly puts her hand on Pam's shoulder] Oh.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Pam, he's just not that into you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I know.  We talked about it and he told me.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: No, seriously Pam, wake up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kelly made me realize something.  She and I have... nothing in common.  And I need more friends.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Define scorched earth policy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: When an attacker goes through another country sometimes they wi...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nyah ah! Too long!  What is the Dharma Initiative?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It is the source of all energy on this planet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wrong.  It is a corporation formed by aliens.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm a very good interviewee.  Why?  Because I have something that nobody else has.  And that is... my brain.  Which makes me charming, witty, intelligent... [long pause] and quick on my feet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who was the second man on the moon?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Trick question.  There was no second man on the moon.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Inventor of the cotton gin.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Eli Edison.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Talk me through an appendectomy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Step 1, disinfection.  Step 2, incision.  Step 3, remove the appendix tenderly so it doesn't burst and spread toxic...icity everywhere.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Step 5, [talking over Andy, indistinct] ...the wound.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Re-suture.  Sutures, yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When is the Paleolithic Age?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is a scented candle?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How is the new boss?  Tough.  Do people respect him?  They have to.  Do they like him?  Irrelevant.  They do not.  And I hate them back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: New York real estate.  I started by looking for a brownstone, like the Huxtables had, [shakes head] but instead I found this very, very, nice place in Jamaica, Queens, mon.  It is on the last stop of the subway, which is wonderful, because if I fall asleep, I still end up at home.  It is a suh-weeeet one bedroom.  I have a roommate, uh, Vijay Chokalingham, he's a sophomore at Queens College.  He actually works in the Indian restaurant right below the apartment, so... free food, and the place always smells like curry.  So, win/win.
